Paragraph: Here we report multiple cases of bilateral abductor paralysis following Botox injections for ADSD , a complication previously unreported .

| bilateral abductor paralysis (a medical condition) |

Note: I am assuming that "ADSD" stands for a specific medical condition, although it is not a well-known abbreviation. If it does not stand for a medical condition, then there would be only one disease entity in the paragraph, which is "bilateral abductor paralysis".

Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Here we report multiple cases of bilateral abductor paralysis following Botox injections for ADSD , a complication previously unreported .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| Botox |

The only chemical entity in the paragraph is "Botox", which is short for Botulinum toxin. It is a neurotoxic protein produced by the bacterium Clostridium botulinum.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| Botox |

The only entity in the paragraph that clearly refers to a chemical is "Botox", which is short for Botulinum toxin. I have removed any ambiguous entities and present the updated table above.
